meanings.definition: An officer of arms ranking below a herald.
meanings.sent1: The pursuivants carried the royal banners during the procession.
meanings.sent2: The pursuivants announced the arrival of the king with trumpets.
meanings.sent3: The pursuivants tripped over their own feet while trying to keep up with the heralds.
meanings.sent4: The pursuivants' colorful uniforms stood out in the crowd like bright flowers.
meanings.sent5: The pursuivants' role was crucial in maintaining order and tradition in the royal court.

meanings.sent1: The young prince's pursuivants followed him everywhere he went.
meanings.sent2: The pursuivants assisted the noble lady with her heavy gown.
meanings.sent3: The pursuivants eagerly awaited their master's next command.
meanings.sent4: The pursuivants' loyalty to their leader was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The pursuivants' presence added an air of importance to the event.
